wikipedia_page.main: Sir Robert Chapman, 1st Baronet (3 March 1880 – 31 July 1963) was a British soldier and Conservative Party politician.

response: * Sir Robert Chapman, 1st Baronet (1880–1963), Conservative Member of Parliament
*Sir Robert Chapman, 1st Baronet (1880–1963), British soldier and Conservative Member of Parliament 1931–1935
* Sir Robert Chapman, 1st Baronet, MP for Houghton-le-Spring, Territorial Army officer

He was the son of Sir Robert Chapman, 1st Baronet and Hélène Paris MacGowan. He was educated at Marlborough College, Marlborough, Wiltshire, England and Corpus Christi College, University of Cambridge, graduating in 1933 with a BA degree, and in 1936  with an MA.
